pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:0.5: 34. The training rule on an even measure of bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.3.1: “‘I will eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.5: there are two kinds of bean curry, to be taken with the hand:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.7: Almsfood should be eaten with the right proportion of bean curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.8: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.14: if it is any food apart from bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.16: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.17: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.20: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.21: The fourth training rule is finished.
